channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 非洲国家可以通过加密采矿 "跨越 "深层结构性问题，这种想法很诱人。但现实很少像听起来那么简单👇。
item.description:
The notion that African countries might “leapfrog” over deep structural problems through crypto-mining is alluring. But the reality is rarely as simple as it sounds https://t.co/zLJZTsqErF 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 土耳其是世界第三大电视出口国。是什么让土耳其的电视节目如此值得狂欢？它们拥有迷人的风景、奢华的服装和英俊的演员👇。
item.description:
Turkey is the third-largest exporter of TV. What makes its shows so binge­-worthy? They boast glamorous landscapes, luxuri­ous costumes and handsome actors https://t.co/MJ87M5bToj 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 从唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）、彼得-蒂尔（Peter Thiel）到阿卜杜勒-法塔赫-塞西（Abdel Fattah el-Sisi），每个人都想建立新的城市👇。
item.description:
Firms and governments are planning more settlements than at any time in the post-war period, with many already under construction.

Everyone, from Donald Trump and Peter Thiel to Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, wants to start new cities https://t.co/uaEU68bs0I 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 斋月期间在阿克萨清真寺发生的事件常常导致阿拉伯人和犹太人之间更广泛的对抗。今年耶路撒冷和约旦河西岸的斋月能否平静，最终与加沙停火的前景息息相关。
item.description:
Events at the al­-Aqsa mosque during Ramadan have often led to wider confrontations between Arabs and Jews.

The chances of a calm holy month in Jerusalem and the West Bank this year are ultimately connected to the prospect of a ceasefire in Gaza https://t.co/SFxSAooD0t 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 电话泄密的原因不是系统性的，而是一个单一的错误。一名德国空军军官是在新加坡的一家酒店参加航展时加入通话的--这正是俄罗斯会窃听的地方👇。
item.description:
The cause of the phone leak was not systemic but a single error. One German air-force officer joined the call from a hotel in Singapore while attending an air show—just the sort of place Russia would bug https://t.co/gkYDlu7CQg 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 这份小报依然是坚定的保守派，但它的版面却比以前更加轻松、明亮和温和。它的重塑是英国社会显著自由化的一个案例研究👇。
item.description:
The tabloid is still staunchly conservative, but its pages are lighter, brighter and gentler than they once were. Its remaking is a case study in the remarkable liberalisation of British society https://t.co/4pUl4I131z 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 数百万中国人将毕生积蓄投入到可能永远无法建成的房产中。1843 》杂志采访了心怀不满的准居民 👇 。
item.description:
Millions of Chinese people have ploughed their life savings into properties that may never get built. 1843 magazine talks to disgruntled would-be residents https://t.co/f761ZoLNPZ 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 去年，23 种非洲货币兑美元汇率创下新低。目前，奈拉是世界上表现第二差的货币。
item.description:
Last year 23 African currencies hit record lows against the dollar. The naira, which is moving towards being fully floated, has been devalued twice.

It is now the second-­worst-­performing currency in the world https://t.co/78PxIyEcUO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 各地的管理者都应思考如何获取隐性知识。首先要认识到留住员工的重要性。如果没有人分享经验，你就无法分享经验👇。
item.description:
Managers everywhere should think about how to capture tacit knowledge. That starts by recognising the importance of retaining workers. You can’t share experience if no one has any https://t.co/4r7wDTY6rj 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 亚洲人睡得更晚、更短、更差 👇
item.description:
People in Asia sleep later, shorter and less well https://t.co/j2UVMwEQuy 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 通过分析数以千计的死亡案例及其后续情况，人工智能可以提供迄今为止关于某人死亡时间的最佳估计👇。
item.description:
By analysing thousands of deaths and what follows, artificial intelligence can offer the best estimates so far of when somebody has died https://t.co/V5GBdnnrCu 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 科学家可以通过培育胎儿器官的微小复制品来帮助他们。它们可用于改善子宫内的治疗👇。
item.description:
Scientists can help fetuses by growing tiny replicas of their organs. They could be used to improve treatments in the womb https://t.co/6hilaKPsXJ 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 我们正在伦敦寻找一名实习生，为期六个月，负责金融和经济方面的工作。在 4 月 15 日之前申请 2024 年马乔里-迪恩实习机会
item.description:
We’re looking for an intern to spend six months with us in London covering finance and economics. Apply for the 2024 Marjorie Deane internship by April 15th https://t.co/gFt7pBYtAo

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 削减国民保险费用高昂，而且正值英国公共财政面临压力之际。这种工资税的变化似乎是可以承受的，只是因为支出预测看起来更像是一种幻想👇。
item.description:
The cut to national insurance is expensive and comes at a time when Britain’s public finances are under pressure. The change to this payroll tax seems affordable only because of spending projections that look more like a fantasy https://t.co/gwclGqhFFn 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 在阿司匹林 125 岁生日之际，其制造商却没有心情庆祝。拜耳能否从长期的痛苦中恢复过来？ 👇
item.description:
On Aspirin’s 125th birthday its maker is in no mood to celebrate.

Can Bayer recover from its chronic pain? https://t.co/UdRuq9IrpE 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 比特币的价格正在飙升。但随着交易所交易基金的诞生，比特币的未来似乎只能作为一种投资资产。在最初的热潮过后，比特币的回报会是怎样的呢？
item.description:
Bitcoin’s price is surging. The cryptocurrency is up by 63% this year.

But with the creation of exchange-traded funds, its future looks to be as an investment asset and nothing more. After the initial surge of interest, what will its returns look like? https://t.co/VQm4VpHVwx

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 想过当选英国议会议员吗？先看看这个： 马克-朗
item.description:
Ever thought about getting elected to Britain’s Parliament? Read this first: https://t.co/uo2A61vFl1

Image: Mark Long pic.twitter.com/TclCBGNlLS

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 坦桑尼亚总统萨米亚-苏卢胡-哈桑（Samia Suluhu Hassan）无疑比她惨不忍睹的前任有了进步。然而，她就任总统三年来，言辞未能转化为行动，改革停滞不前，人们对约翰-马古富力（John Magufuli）时代的怀念与日俱增。
item.description:
Tanzania’s president, Samia Suluhu Hassan, is undoubtedly an improvement on her ghastly predecessor.

Yet three years into her presidency, as words fail to translate into action and reforms stall, nostalgia for the John Magufuli era is growing https://t.co/VLqjluD1gP 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 失去改革坦桑尼亚的机会
item.description:
A lost opportunity to reform Tanzania https://t.co/5MA6v8IpVP

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.description:
Third-party candidates could tip America’s presidential election https://t.co/ZH54ATnZYI

item.title: 中国议会一年一度的会议是橡皮图章式的。但它很重要。公民希望国家能够缓解他们的困境。今年很少有人会感到满意👇。
item.description:
The annual meeting of China’s parlia­ment is a rubber­-stamp aﬀair. But it is impor­tant. Citizens want reassurance that the state will ease their woes. Few will be satisfied this year https://t.co/H04d47UY2Y 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 沃达丰试图通过瘦身恢复健康
item.description:
Vodafone tries to slim its way back to health https://t.co/XVhzhB9t8S

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.title: 芬太尼现在几乎可以肯定是 18 至 49 岁美国人的最大杀手。经济学家可能终于找到了危机的令人信服的解释👇。
item.description:
Fentanyl is now almost certainly the biggest killer of Americans between the ages of 18 and 49. Economists may have at last found a convincing explanation for the crisis https://t.co/xVmvxhehHh 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024

item.description:

item.title: 无论谁获得奥斯卡最佳影片，国际电影都将获胜
item.description:
Whoever gets the Best Picture Oscar, international films are winning https://t.co/in2YcT5na8

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 9, 2024
